subject: Sleep
title: The Light Bulb Changed Sleep Forever
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Light Bulb Changed Sleep Forever.

hook.text: Thomas Edison saw sleep as a waste of time and his invention ensured the world would get less of it.

buildup.text: Before electric light, people slept an estimated nine to ten hours in winter and seven to eight in summer.

discovery.text: Electric lighting decoupled human activity from the sun for the first time in history.

twist.text: Edison boasted about sleeping four hours a night and called long sleepers lazy. His assistant said he napped constantly.

climax.text: Within a generation of widespread electrification, average sleep duration dropped by one to two hours.

punchline.text: Edison lit up the world and dimmed our sleep.

quiz.question: How did electric lighting affect sleep duration?
options: It increased sleep by allowing bedrooms to be lit
Average sleep dropped by one to two hours within a generation
It had no measurable effect on sleep
